paper_title.ja: 超高エネルギー宇宙線・JEM-EUSO実験（Phase-A研究） : 望遠鏡性能のシミュレーション評価

publication_name.ja: 総合研究機構研究プロジェクト研究成果報告書

paper_title.en: Cosmic ray nuclear interactions and EAS-triggered families observed by the Chacaltaya hybrid experiment

description.en: Longitudinal and lateral characteristics of the families detected by emulsion chambers in the hybrid experiment with AS-array at Mt. Chacaltaya are studied in detail. Although many groups discuss about an increase of the heavy component in primary cosmic-rays beyond the knee region, it is shown that the observed characteristics of the families accompanied by large shower size, Ne > 10(6), can not be explained by an increase of heavy primaries alone. It is necessary to assume some changes of nuclear interaction in order to explain the observed chaxacteristics of the air-showers accompanied by families.

paper_title.en: Simulation study on identifiability of UHE gamma-ray air showers

description.en: The chemical composition of Ultra-High-Energy (UHE) comic rays is one of unsolved mysteries, and its study will give us fruitful information on the origin and acceleration mechanism of UHE cosmic rays. Especially, a detection of UHE gamma-rays by hybrid experiments, such as AUGER and TA, will be a key to solve these questions. The characteristics of UHE gamma-ray showers have been studied by comparing the lateral and longitudinal structures of shower particles calculated with AIRES and our own simulation code, so far. There are apparent differences in a slope of lateral distribution (eta) and a depth of shower maximum (Xmax) between gamma-ray and proton induced showers because UHE gamma-ray showers are affected by the LPM effect and the geomagnetic cascading process in an energy region of >10(19.5) eV. Different features between gamma-ray and proton showers are pointed out from the simulation study and an identifiability of gamma-ray showers from proton ones is also discussed by the method of Neural-Network-Analysis.

paper_title.ja: Simulation Study on Identifiability of UHE Gamma-ray Air Showers by Neural-Network-Analysis

publication_name.ja: Proc. of Intern. Workshop on Cosmic-rays and High Energy Universe, Universal Academy Press, Inc.

paper_title.en: Performance of a multi-anode photomultiplier employing a weak electrostatic focusing system (Hamamatsu R8900 series)

description.en: We have developed and tested a new type of multi-anode photomultiplier: Hamamatsu R8900-03 series. The main feature of the R8900-03 series is a highly sensitive surface: similar to 83% of the physical area. In this paper we report on the results of measurements we performed to check several parameters of this new type of photomultiplier. R8900-03 photomultipliers are devices suitable for experiments where large collection area and uniform detection efficiency are essential characteristics. (c) 2006 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

publication_name.en: NUCLEAR INSTRUMENTS & METHODS IN PHYSICS RESEARCH SECTION A-ACCELERATORS SPECTROMETERS DETECTORS AND ASSOCIATED EQUIPMENT

publication_name.ja: 総合研究機構研究プロジェクト研究成果報告書

paper_title.en: A halo event observed by the hybrid experiment at Mt. Chacaltaya

description.en:
An experiment using an air shower array, a hadron calorimeter and an emulsion chamber is under way at Mt. Chacaltaya (5200 m, Bolivia). One of the highest energy events, having a halo (similar to 1 cm) in the centre of the family together with many gamma-ray and hadron showers, is analyzed in detail.
Available data for the event are on the halo (E-halo = 750 TeV) and on the high energy particles of electron/photon components by the emulsion chamber, and on the characteristics of the accompanied air shower (Ne = 7.0 x 10(7), s = 0.59) by the air shower array.
The diagram of the air shower size and the total energy of electron/photon components in the family, which shows discrepancy between the experimental data and simulated events (QCSJET code for nuclear collisions) in our previous reports, is discussed including the present event.

paper_title.en: The LPM showers traversing the atmosphere

description.en: We simulate the LPM showers due to Extremely-High-Energy(EHE) neutrinos traversing atmosphere horizontally without colliding with the Earth. We calculate the LPM showers with energies of 10(17) eV to 10(22) eV, using the hybrid method as exactly as possible. Reflecting the complicated change in the air density along the trajectories of the shower developments, the variety of the LPM showers is shown to depend on their starting points and their heights. The EHE LPM showers in atmosphere are exclusively produced by EHE neutrinos. Therefore, the studies on the LPM showers are very important for EHE neutrino astrophysics. As an example, the air fluorescence photon profiles of the LPM showers are also given for the future satellite-based experiment.

publication_name.en: Taup 2005: Proceedings of the Ninth International Conference on Topics in Astroparticle and Underground Physics

research_project_title.ja: 超高エネルギー宇宙線起源

description.ja: 10<SUP>13</SUP>－10<SUP>20</SUP>eV領域宇宙粒子線の起源，化学組成に関する実験的研究。最高エネルギー領域（～10<SUP>20</SUP>eV）での宇宙粒子線の観測（AGSA実験）によるその銀河系起源，加速機構についての研究（Phys. Rev. Lett., 1998），また同実験装置にて空気シャワーミューオン成分の測定による化学組成の検討を行ってきた。10<SUP>16</SUP>eV 領域では南米チャカル・/SUP>ヤ山（5200m）における宇宙粒子線による高エネルギー相互作用の研究を行い，2次粒子発生多重度の急激な増加を示唆する結果を得てきている（Phy. Rev, 2000）。今後，広いエネルギー領域でのenergy spectrumの微細構造とその物理的解釈，宇宙陽子成分の高山における直接観測についての研究を進めていきたい。

research_project_title.en: Origin of ultra high energy cosmic ray

research_project_title.ja: 高エネルギー粒子相互作用
